intro: Tridens quinquefidus, commonly known as the five-ribbed tridens, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils along stream banks and woodland edges. Tridens quinquefidus is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
